content:
Thought it was worth a PSA. Cerner soon following in the open.epic.com model and listing all endpoints publically, as well as enabling automatic access to patient auth apps holistically (instead of HCO-by-HCO gatekeeping)

https://twitter.com/healthbjk/status/1455702506525192195?s=20

yoooooooo hell yeah @Cerner light it up and turn them on another EHR finally following in the http://open.epic.com footsteps and enabling patient apps to just work https://groups.google.com/g/cerner-fhir-developers/c/Yf6sxjg0I7U

- Brendan Keeler (@healthbjk)

These enhancements will enable automatic connections between all registered Consumer Apps and active Providers’ Systems

This isn't 100% clear to me. Will the connections be "enabled"' meaning on by default, or just in a state where active providers can control them?

The previous process was HCO owned and maintained activation.

The current process as of Oct 1 suggests a consumer app can gain access to any provider by emailing a Cerner rep: "As of October 1, 2021, connections between registered Consumer Apps and Providers’ Systems will be established upon the Consumer App developer’s request." (the link links to a Cerner email), suggesting they've centralized the process.

So I imagine the future process being open, although there's a slightly chance it's something different/
